intro: Jasione perennis var. alpestris, commonly known as alpine jasione, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Jasione perennis var. alpestris is often found in meadows and mountainous areas where it contributes to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
